title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
sburjan` joined #xwiki at 00:08  
sburjan` left at 00:08 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
sburjan` joined #xwiki at 00:10  
fmancinelli left at 00:23 (Quit: leaving  
sburjan` - (00:57): intresting :)  
sburjan` - (00:57): Xwiki on Wikipedia :)  
sdumitriu - (00:57): Yeah, it's been there for a long time  
sburjan` - (00:57): although the latest stable isn't 2.4 ?  
sburjan` - (00:58): sience yesterday :P  
sdumitriu - (00:58): sburjan`: You should run a quick check of the 2.4 release ( http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download )  
sdumitriu - (00:58): But isn't it 2.4 on Wikipedia?  
sdumitriu - (00:58): I just updated it a few hours ago  
sburjan` - (00:59): yas, but I was refering to the wiki\s comparation page  
npm left at 01:00 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
sdumitriu - (01:01): Ah, yes  
sdumitriu - (01:01): I was on it right now  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 01:04  
sdumitriu - (01:06): Refresh: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison\_of\_wiki\_software  
sdumitriu - (01:08): lucaa: The annotations tab works now  
sdumitriu - (01:08): I tested it  
sdumitriu - (01:09): All that's left for the release is a final test, then send the announcement email  
lucaa - (01:11): thanks sdumitriu, for remaking the release for this  
sdumitriu - (01:11): You're welcome  
npm joined #xwiki at 01:14  
npm left at 01:16 (Remote host closed the connection  
sburjan` - (01:17): tomorrow I'll retest  
sburjan` - (01:17): and start writing the pane for annotations tab

vmassol joined #xwiki at 12:47  
sdumitriu - (12:58): Guys, did you test the final 2.4?  
sdumitriu - (12:58): Can I announce it?  
sdumitriu - (13:00): sburjan, silviar  
sburjan - (13:01): Anotations tab works  
sburjan - (13:01): except the 2 nasty bugs I just reported ... I hope we didn;t miss any CORE functionality  
sburjan - (13:01): that breaks  
sburjan - (13:01): +1 for announcing  
silviar - (13:02): you may want to take a look at this bug http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5362  
silviar - (13:03): i've reported another minor issue, but didn't notice anything big so far  
silviar - (13:03): +1  
lucaa left at 13:20 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
asrfel joined #xwiki at 13:46  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 14:39  
sdumitriu - (15:07): OK, 2.4 release finally done  
jvdrean - (15:07): \o/  
sdumitriu - (15:07): I think I'll volunteer as the release manager for 2.5  
sdumitriu - (15:08): I haven't done this in a while, my previous release was 1.8.3  
jvdrean - (15:09): I'd happily let you do the 2.5 series releases  
sdumitriu - (15:14): vmassol: I think this one is no longer valid: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-557  
jvdrean - (16:47): hum, I was relying on $context.display in some sheet but it doesn't seem to be set when the doc is new  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 16:48  
bblfish - (16:49): hi, a quick question. Does the @ComponentRole have to be on every object that is used inside velocity?  
jvelociter - (16:50): hi bblfish . No  
jvelociter - (16:50): you can manipulate any java object in velocity. Not just Xwiki components  
bblfish - (16:51): oh. ok. Good. So the only annotation that is really needed is @Component("foafssl")  
bblfish - (16:51): the one you use to get access to the library  
jvelociter - (16:51): for a script serivce you mean ?  
bblfish - (16:52): http://github.com/bblfish/keygenapp/blob/master/xwiki/foafssl-component/src/main/java/net/bblfish/dev/foafssl/xwiki/internal/CertificateScriptService.java  
bblfish - (16:52): for that  
bblfish - (16:52): yes  
jvelociter - (16:53): yes should be enough  
bblfish - (16:53): so the method there  
bblfish - (16:53): public Certificate createFromSpkac(String spkac)  
bblfish - (16:53): the Certificate does not need an annotation?  
bblfish - (16:53): (Just wondering why I added one then...)  
jvelociter - (16:54): no it does not  
jvelociter - (16:54): I mean it does not necessarly  
jvelociter - (16:54): maybe you need it for another reason, I don't know  
bblfish - (16:54): any reason for the @ComponentRole annotation?  
bblfish - (16:54): not sure why I have it  
sburjan left at 16:54 (Remote host closed the connection  
bblfish - (16:55): I mean I am happy if I don't need it. It can make sharing code a lot easier  
bblfish - (16:56): I seem to have put such annotations on every interface http://github.com/bblfish/keygenapp/blob/master/xwiki/foafssl-component/src/main/java/net/bblfish/dev/foafssl/xwiki/Certificate.java  
abusenius - (16:57): if you don't need it to be accessible over @Requirement, you don't need to make it a component  
abusenius - (16:58): if you use another components in it using @Requirement, you need to make it a component :)  
bblfish - (16:58): ah, ok… mhh  
abusenius - (16:58): (in implementations it is)  
bblfish - (16:59): I think I don't have any code with an @Requirement  
bblfish - (16:59): probably we thought I might need it  
bblfish - (17:00): good. that makes everything a lot easier  
bblfish - (17:00): As I can put a library together with no dependencies on xwiki, then just add a small lib for xwiki  
lpereira left at 17:00 (Quit: Leaving.  
sdumitriu - (17:07): Hm, I think there might be a security issue with skin extensions, jsrx  
sdumitriu - (17:07): It can be used to read sensitive information located in jars  
sdumitriu - (17:08): Like $xwiki.jsrx.use('META-INF/passwords.txt')  
sdumitriu - (17:08): Do you think that's a problem?  
sdumitriu - (17:08): Should we also sandbox jsrx so that it only uses files located in the resources folder in the jar?  
sdumitriu - (17:09): jvelociter, jvdrean, abusenius, CalebJamesDeLisl: WDYT?  
jvelociter - (17:10): mmh . I'd say yes probably  
jvdrean - (17:10): sdumitriu: yes, we should probably sandbox  
abusenius - (17:10): +1  
jvdrean - (17:11): sdumitriu: any take on my context.display issue ? context.put("display", "edit") is done in InlineAction but it does not appear to be set when displayed from a sheet when the doc isNew  
sdumitriu - (17:12): jvdrean: No idea, I can look if you want  
jvdrean - (17:14): I'll look at it in debug mode, I'll get back to you if I still can find out what happens after that  
jvdrean - (17:14): s/can/can't/  
asrfel left at 17:17 (Quit: Leaving.  
evalica left #xwiki at 17:18  
bblfish left at 17:23 (Ping timeout: 248 seconds  
Enygma` left at 17:24 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 17:24  
bblfish - (17:27): can one use the normal java logging in xwiki, or does it have to be using the AbstractLogEnabled interface?  
sdumitriu - (17:30): bblfish: You can use normal logging  
bblfish - (17:30): ok, thanks.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:34): I think there are a number of other ways to get the content of a jar.  
sdumitriu - (17:35): From Velocity?  
sdumitriu - (17:35): Or from an URL?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:36): Velocity...   I see your point.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:36): +1  
proyvind joined #xwiki at 17:37  
proyvind - (17:37): hm  
proyvind - (17:37): I'm trying to import a backup to a new xwiki  
proyvind - (17:38): and I'm getting nagged about the 10M limit, but even if I increase upload\_maxsize, I still get the same..  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (17:39): How big is the backup?  
proyvind - (17:40): [peroyvind@localhost ~]$ ls -l final\_jokke\_xwiki\_snapshot.xar  
proyvind - (17:40): -r--r--r-- 1 peroyvind peroyvind 35434619 2010-07-21 17:03 final\_jokke\_xwiki\_snapshot.xar  
sdumitriu - (17:41): proyvind: There are several limits on that size:  
sdumitriu - (17:41): 1. database limit for a query  
sdumitriu - (17:41): on mysql there's something like packet\_max\_size  
sdumitriu - (17:42): 2. XWiki's upload\_maxsize  
sdumitriu - (17:42): 3. Memory requirements  
proyvind - (17:42): well  
proyvind - (17:42): XWiki has a default limit of around 10Mb for attached files. This limit can be changed using the upload\_maxsize parameter. Check the FAQ for more information.  
proyvind - (17:42): is what it tells kme  
sdumitriu - (17:42): For 35M, you should allocate at least 1G of memory to the java machine  
florinciu1 left at 17:43 (Quit: Leaving.  
sdumitriu - (17:43): Don't mind the error message  
sdumitriu - (17:43): It's displayed for any error  
proyvind - (17:43): oh  
proyvind - (17:44): how intuitive :p  
sdumitriu - (17:44): Yeah, that code needs to be updated a bit  
proyvind - (17:45): where should I look for debugging? xwiki.log?  
proyvind - (17:45): tomcat's own logs?  
proyvind - (17:49): http://pastebin.mandriva.com/19360 <- from catalina.out, which mentions some stuff at least ;p  
sdumitriu - (17:51): Yes, catalina.out has the most detailed logs  
mflorea left at 17:52 (Ping timeout: 248 seconds  
lucaa left at 17:52 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
silviar left at 17:53 (Ping timeout: 260 seconds  
silviar joined #xwiki at 18:00  
proyvind - (18:01): sdumitriu: did it provide you with any sense?  
sdumitriu - (18:01): No, those are not related  
sdumitriu - (18:01): Did you check the 3 items I mentioned above?  
sdumitriu - (18:02): max\_allowed\_packet in my.cnf  
proyvind - (18:02): yeah, they should be okay, I did manage to get it working yesterday  
proyvind - (18:02): using postgresql  
sdumitriu - (18:02): -Xmx in CATALINA\_OPTS  
proyvind - (18:03): but then only after manually modifying the value in the database afterwards  
proyvind - (18:03): IIRC  
proyvind - (18:03): lemme see  
proyvind - (18:08): yeah  
proyvind - (18:08): it should have stored it in xwikilongs, right?  
sdumitriu - (18:09): The upload\_maxsize?  
sdumitriu - (18:09): Yes  
proyvind - (18:09): it doesn't seem to do that  
proyvind - (18:09): it only saves it in some xml form in the database  
bblfish left at 18:10 (Quit: Leaving.  
proyvind - (18:11): it should be sufficient  to just fill out the size field, and choosing save, right?  
silviar left at 18:15 (Quit: Leaving.  
proyvind - (18:27): hum  
proyvind - (18:27): now I feel a bit stupid  
proyvind - (18:27): and a bit confused  
proyvind - (18:28): there's a maxsize\_upload & upload\_maxsize?  
sdumitriu - (18:29): No  
sdumitriu - (18:29): Just upload\_maxsize  
proyvind - (18:30): I wonder why there suddenly are two fields here now then, maybe I've managed to add it by mistake or something, dunno if it was there earlier or not, it's at the bottom of the list.. :p  
npm left at 18:31 (Remote host closed the connection  
proyvind - (18:35): yeah, I definitely don't have that one in my other database  
proyvind - (18:35): and now it was gone  
proyvind - (18:35): huh  
proyvind - (18:35): weird  
proyvind - (18:35): ah  
proyvind - (18:35): nah  
proyvind - (18:36): it was me being silly
